last_episode_to_air.name: Control
last_episode_to_air.overview: Demetri wrestles with when it's good to be in control, particularly when struggling with a piñata.

name: Important Things with Demetri Martin
overview: Important Things with Demetri Martin is a sketch-variety show that aired on Comedy Central starring comedian Demetri Martin. Each episode examined a single theme, the "important thing", such as timing, power, control and money. All sketches, short vignettes, animated segments and stand-up comedy were loosely related to the theme of the episode. The show was produced by Jon Stewart's Busboy Productions, and contains stand-up, prop comedy and musical comedy by Martin, as well as taped sketches. Jon Stewart took an active role in editing the first few episodes.

episodes.name: Timing
episodes.overview: Demetri has trouble mustering the necessary anger for a breakup, time traveling for noble purposes and measuring his hobo-ness.

episodes.name: Power
episodes.overview: Demetri ponders the nature of power, proves that bird ownership is arrogant and introduces The Revenger.

episodes.name: Brains
episodes.overview: Demetri does away with traditional neuroscience and phrenology as he digs into brains.

episodes.name: Chairs
episodes.overview: Demetri considers the many mysteries surrounding chairs.

episodes.name: Safety
episodes.overview: Demetri's safety tips: Employ scented candles as a fire alarm, use pubic hair for home security, and maintain a healthy fear of piñatas.

episodes.name: Coolness
episodes.overview: Demetri is too cool for clear pants, but he still needs professional help before a date.

episodes.name: Games
episodes.overview: Demetri trades in fun, games and audience threats while reimagining pro sports as animal duels.

episodes.name: Attention
episodes.overview: Comedic dogs and patients who deliver toasts while handing doctors their urine samples need attention, just like Demetri.

episodes.name: Ability
episodes.overview: Demetri finds that people with special abilities -- unicyclists, amateur midwives and people who can simultaneously laugh and pee -- are in short supply.

episodes.name: Strategy
episodes.overview: Demetri knows that a man is only as good as his plan, so he explores the best strategy for seduction, suing your neighbor over a fence and reacting to alien life.

episodes.name: Money
episodes.overview: Demetri finds there's more than one way to acquire wealth since it's not enough to be born with a silver spoon in your mouth -- sometimes you gotta shave a snake.
Demetri examines the number 2 from every vantage, from the biological -- as when two women hit the lavatory to dissect a blind date -- to basic but unnoticed social cues.

episodes.name: 2, Too
episodes.overview: Demetri returns to the number 2, shining a spotlight on Superman's duplicitous sidekick and how the shape of the number 2 conveys vital information.

episodes.name: Lines
episodes.overview: Demetri demonstrates how adding lines to a drawing can change everything and laments the lack of pick-up line equivalents for breaking up.

episodes.name: Nature
episodes.overview: The natural world beguiles Demetri as he expounds on the cruelty of duck hunting and Bigfoot's mysterious sexual orientation.

episodes.name: Space
episodes.overview: Demetri finds that spaces in a sentence are just as important as word choice and learns that space travel in the future is disconcertingly simple.

episodes.name: Control
episodes.overview: Demetri wrestles with when it's good to be in control, particularly when struggling with a piñata.
